title: Figma Launches Three AI-Powered Tools for Precise Image Editing on Canvas

paragraphs.content: Figma has introduced three new AI-powered image editing tools—**Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image**—enabling designers to perform precise edits directly within the Figma canvas without external applications. **Erase object** removes unwanted elements cleanly, **Isolate object** separates subjects for movement or effects like blur and lighting adjustments, and **Expand image** extends backgrounds to new aspect ratios without distortion. These tools integrate into a revamped toolbar alongside features like Crop and Remove background, prioritizing frequent actions for better workflow efficiency.

paragraphs.content: The tools emphasize designer control by avoiding text prompts, allowing direct selection and manipulation on images. They address common pain points like exporting to Photoshop for tweaks, reducing back-and-forth in cross-functional reviews. Availability is limited to Full seat users on Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled in Figma Design and Figma Draw.

sections.title: Unified Toolbar Streamlines Image Editing Access

paragraphs.content: Figma's updated image editing toolbar consolidates new AI tools with existing ones, placing Remove background prominently due to its high usage for UI mockups and brand consistency. This centralization eliminates navigation friction, letting users select objects, adjust colors, or add annotations in one spot. Designers benefit from lasso tool improvements for precise object selection and isolation without altering background characteristics.

paragraphs.content: The toolbar supports contextual edits like boosting image resolution or filling frames, shared across Figma products via AI credits. Nano Banana and similar models handle generation, but these tools focus on granular editing control. Figma AI extends to layer renaming and content generation, enhancing overall canvas productivity.

sections.title: Competitive Push Matches Adobe and Canva Capabilities

paragraphs.content: Figma's launch catches up to rivals Adobe and Canva, which have offered object removal for years, by embedding similar precision features natively. The announcement coincided with Adobe integrating comparable tools into ChatGPT, intensifying AI editing competition. Performance marketers gain from faster asset adaptation without design team dependencies.

paragraphs.content: Figma plans broader rollout across its platform next year, expanding access beyond Design and Draw. These updates position Figma as a full visual design hub, minimizing multi-app workflows. Teams anticipate reduced creative bottlenecks through assistive AI.
